steps.title: Row 2:
steps.content: Row 2: Purl 5. Alternating knit and purl rows creates the Stockinette. On the right side, this stitch looks like a series of V's. The wrong side is bumpy, and resembles the Garter stitch.

steps.title: Repeat rows 1 and 2 until the bracelet is the required length.
steps.content: Repeat rows 1 and 2 until the bracelet is the required length.

steps.title: On a knit row, cast off.
steps.content: On a knit row, cast off. Leave a six inch tail.

steps.title: Thread the tail on to a wool needle and seam up the cast on and cast off row together using a duplicate stitch.
steps.content: Thread the tail on to a wool needle and seam up the cast on and cast off row together using a duplicate stitch.

steps.title: Thread a 18 inch (45.7 cm) piece of yarn onto the thread needle.
steps.content: Thread a 18 inch (45.7 cm) piece of yarn onto the thread needle. Tie a double knot with the yarn and sew the seams together with a simple whipstitch.
